spans.content: Table 5: An example of single-response evaluation and the judgment given by AUTo-J.We highlight
the parts of the judgment that capture the crux of the matter in green.
In this work,we develop AUTO-J,a generative judge with 13B parameters for evaluating alignment,
which is devised toaddress thechallenges ingenerality,flexibility,and interpretability.We createa
new judgment dataset for diverse evaluation protocols,containing user queries and responses from
different LLMs under massive real-world scenarios,and wel-structured natural language critiques.
Experiments demonstrate that AUTo-J significantly outperforms both open-source and closed-source
baselines models.Last but not least,we releasea wealth of resources to facilitate future research.
Published as a conference paper at ICLR 2024

spans.content: Table 5: An example of single-response evaluation and the judgment given by AUTo-J.We highlight
the parts of the judgment that capture the crux of the matter in green.
In this work,we develop AUTO-J,a generative judge with 13B parameters for evaluating alignment,
which is devised toaddress thechallenges ingenerality,flexibility,and interpretability.We createa
new judgment dataset for diverse evaluation protocols,containing user queries and responses from
different LLMs under massive real-world scenarios,and wel-structured natural language critiques.
Experiments demonstrate that AUTo-J significantly outperforms both open-source and closed-source
baselines models.Last but not least,we releasea wealth of resources to facilitate future research.
